member.name: T:Ikadn.Utilities.CharacterAction
member.summary: Action to be performed with a character.

member.name: F:Ikadn.Utilities.CharacterAction.NoAction
member.summary: Perform no action. Reader won't advance to the next character.

member.name: F:Ikadn.Utilities.CharacterAction.Skip
member.summary: Don't add anything to the result and continue reading.

member.name: F:Ikadn.Utilities.CharacterAction.AcceptAsIs
member.summary: Add the character as it is to the ressult.

member.name: F:Ikadn.Utilities.CharacterAction.Substitute
member.summary: Add specified character to th result instead of read character.

member.name: F:Ikadn.Utilities.CharacterAction.AllInputActions
member.summary: Mask for input interpreting actions (accept, substitute, skip).

member.name: F:Ikadn.Utilities.CharacterAction.Stop
member.summary: Reading is finished

member.name: F:Ikadn.Utilities.CharacterAction.SkipStop
member.summary: Combination of skipping a character and stopping the reading.

member.name: T:Ikadn.IkadnReader
member.summary: Helper class with utility methods for parsing and composing text streams with IKADN syntax.

member.name: F:Ikadn.IkadnReader.EndOfStreamResult
member.summary: Value returned by System.IO.TextReader methods when the end of the stream is reached.

member.name: M:Ikadn.IkadnReader.#ctor(System.IO.TextReader)
member.summary: Wraps TextReader with IkonReader

member.name: M:Ikadn.IkadnReader.Peek
member.summary: Gets next character in the input stream without moving to the next.

member.name: M:Ikadn.IkadnReader.PeekNextNonwhite
member.summary: Skips white space characters in the input stream and peeks the next character. Throws System.FormatException if end of stream is reached before a non-white character i found.

member.name: M:Ikadn.IkadnReader.Read
member.summary: Reads next character from the input stream.

member.name: M:Ikadn.IkadnReader.ReadWhile(System.Char[])
member.summary: Reads characters from the input stream until the stopping condition is met.
member.returns: Successfully read part of the stream.

member.name: M:Ikadn.IkadnReader.ReadWhile(System.Collections.Generic.ISet{System.Char})
member.summary: Reads characters from the input stream until the stopping condition is met.
member.param: Set of characters that can be read.
member.returns: Successfully read part of the stream.

member.name: M:Ikadn.IkadnReader.ReadWhile(System.Predicate{System.Char})
member.summary: Reads characters from the input stream until the stopping condition is met.
member.param: Set of characters that can be read.
member.returns: Successfully read part of the stream.

member.name: M:Ikadn.IkadnReader.ReadUntil(System.Int32[])
member.summary: Reads characters from the input stream until one of terminating character is found.
member.returns: Successfully read part of the stream.

member.name: M:Ikadn.IkadnReader.ReadUntil(System.Predicate{System.Int32})
member.summary: Reads characters from the input stream until one of terminating character is found.
member.returns: Successfully read part of the stream.

member.name: M:Ikadn.IkadnReader.ReadConditionally(System.Func{System.Int32,Ikadn.Utilities.ReadingDecision})
member.summary: Reads characters from the input stream until the stopping condition is met.
member.param: Returns whether character should be read (if predicate is true). When predicate evaluates to flase, reading stops.
member.returns: Successfully read part of the stream.

member.name: M:Ikadn.IkadnReader.SkipWhiteSpaces
member.summary: Skips consequentive whitespace characters from the input stream.

member.name: M:Ikadn.IkadnReader.SkipWhile(System.Char[])
member.summary: Skips consequentive characters from the input stream.

member.name: M:Ikadn.IkadnReader.SkipWhile(System.Collections.Generic.ISet{System.Char})
member.summary: Skips consequentive characters from the input stream.
member.param: Set of characters that should be skipped.

member.name: M:Ikadn.IkadnReader.SkipWhile(System.Predicate{System.Char})
member.summary: Skips consequentive characters from the input stream.
member.param: Returns whether character should be skipped (if predicate is true). When predicate evaluates to flase, process stops.

member.name: M:Ikadn.IkadnReader.SkipUntil(System.Int32[])
member.summary: Skips consequentive characters from the input stream.

member.name: M:Ikadn.IkadnReader.SkipUntil(System.Collections.Generic.ISet{System.Int32})
member.summary: Skips consequentive characters from the input stream.
member.param: Set of characters that stop skipping process.

member.name: M:Ikadn.IkadnReader.SkipUntil(System.Predicate{System.Int32})
member.summary: Skips consequentive characters from the input stream.
member.param: Returns whether the terminating condition is met (if predicate is true).

member.name: M:Ikadn.IkadnReader.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Releases the unmanaged resources used by the System.IO.TextReader and optionally releases the managed resources.
member.param: true to release both managed and unmanaged resources; false to release only unmanaged resources.

member.name: M:Ikadn.IkadnReader.Dispose
member.summary: Performs application-defined tasks associated with freeing, releasing, or resetting unmanaged resources.

member.name: P:Ikadn.IkadnReader.Index
member.summary: Index of the last read character.

member.name: P:Ikadn.IkadnReader.Line
member.summary: Line of the last read character.

member.name: P:Ikadn.IkadnReader.Column
member.summary: Column within the line of the last read character.

member.name: P:Ikadn.IkadnReader.PositionDescription
member.summary: Gets text that describes position (line, column and index) of the last successfuly read character from the stream.

member.name: P:Ikadn.IkadnReader.HasNext
member.summary: Indicates whether is it possible to read another character from the input stream.

member.name: T:Ikadn.IkadnWriter
member.summary: Base class for IKADN composers. Composers transform IKADN values to a text.

member.name: M:Ikadn.IkadnWriter.#ctor(System.IO.TextWriter)
member.summary: Constructs basic IKADN composer.

member.name: M:Ikadn.IkadnWriter.Write(System.String)
member.summary: Appends a text to the current line. Text entered with this method is buffered and is not written immediately to the output stream. To finalize the buffered data (and write it to output stream) call either EndLine or WrtieLine.

member.name: M:Ikadn.IkadnWriter.WriteLine(System.String)
member.summary: Appends a text to the current line and writes buffered line to the output stream.

member.name: M:Ikadn.IkadnWriter.EndLine
member.summary: Writes buffered line to the output stream.

member.name: P:Ikadn.IkadnWriter.Writer
member.summary: Output stream where IKADN values are being written.

member.name: P:Ikadn.IkadnWriter.Indentation
member.summary: Indentation level.

member.name: P:Ikadn.IkadnWriter.Line
member.summary: Temporary line contents.

member.summary: Interface for IKADN value factories usable by IKADN parser.

member.summary: Parses input for a IKADN value.

member.name: P:Ikadn.IValueFactory.Sign
member.summary: Character that identifies value parcable by factory.

member.name: T:Ikadn.Utilities.ReadingDecision
member.summary: Describes action to be performed for certain character.

member.name: F:Ikadn.Utilities.ReadingDecision.Character
member.summary: Character in question or new character is substitution is in to be perforemd.

member.name: F:Ikadn.Utilities.ReadingDecision.Decision
member.summary: The action to be performed.

member.name: M:Ikadn.Utilities.ReadingDecision.#ctor(System.Char,Ikadn.Utilities.CharacterAction)
member.summary: Initializes reading decision result.
member.param: Character in question or new character is substitution is in to be perforemd.

member.name: M:Ikadn.Utilities.ReadingDecision.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Returns a value indicating whether this instance is equal to a specified object.
member.param: An object to compare with this instance, or null.
member.returns: True if this and obj represent equal value.

member.name: M:Ikadn.Utilities.ReadingDecision.GetHashCode
member.summary: Returns the hash code for the value of this instance.

member.name: M:Ikadn.Utilities.ReadingDecision.op_Equality(Ikadn.Utilities.ReadingDecision,Ikadn.Utilities.ReadingDecision)
member.summary: Returns a value indicating whether a left hand value is equal to a right hand value.
member.returns: True if a left hand and a right hand value are equal.

member.name: M:Ikadn.Utilities.ReadingDecision.op_Inequality(Ikadn.Utilities.ReadingDecision,Ikadn.Utilities.ReadingDecision)
member.summary: Returns a value indicating whether a left hand value is different than a right hand value.
member.returns: True if a left hand and a right hand value are not equal.

member.name: T:Ikadn.Parser
member.summary: Basic parser for texts streams with IKADN syntax.

member.name: M:Ikadn.Parser.#ctor(System.IO.TextReader)
member.summary: Constructs parser without registerd value factories.

member.name: M:Ikadn.Parser.#ctor(System.IO.TextReader,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Ikadn.IValueFactory})
member.summary: Constructs parser and registers value factories to it.

member.name: M:Ikadn.Parser.RegisterFactory(Ikadn.IValueFactory)
member.summary: Registers a value factory to the parser. If parser already has a factory with the same sign, it will be replaced.

member.name: M:Ikadn.Parser.ParseAll
member.summary: Parses whole input stream.

member.name: M:Ikadn.Parser.HasNext
member.summary: Checks whether parser can read more IKADN values from the input stream.

member.name: M:Ikadn.Parser.ParseNext
member.summary:
Parses and returns next IKADN value from the input stream.
Throws System.IO.EndOfStreamException if end of the input stream is encountered while parsing.

member.name: M:Ikadn.Parser.TryParseNext
member.summary:
Trys to parse next IKADN value from the input stream.
Throws System.FormatException if there is no value factory that can parse curren state of the input.
member.returns: Return an IKADN value if there is one, null otherwise.

member.name: M:Ikadn.Parser.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Releases the unmanaged resources used by the System.IO.TextReader and optionally releases the managed resources.
member.param: true to release both managed and unmanaged resources; false to release only unmanaged resources.

member.name: M:Ikadn.Parser.Dispose
member.summary: Performs application-defined tasks associated with freeing, releasing, or resetting unmanaged resources.

member.name: P:Ikadn.Parser.Factories
member.summary: Collection on value factories.

member.name: P:Ikadn.Parser.Reader
member.summary: Input stream that is being parsed.

member.name: T:Ikadn.ValueQueue
member.summary: Represents a first-in, first-out collection of IKADN values.

member.summary: Initializes a new empty instance of Ikadn.ValueQueue.

member.name: M:Ikadn.ValueQueue.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Ikadn.IkadnBaseValue})
member.summary: Initializes an instance of Ikadn.ValueQueue filled with given elements.
member.param: IKADN values for populating the Ikadn.ValueQueue.

member.name: M:Ikadn.ValueQueue.GetEnumerator
member.summary: Returns an enumerator that iterates through the collection.

member.name: M:Ikadn.ValueQueue.System#Collections#IEnumerable#GetEnumerator
member.summary: Returns an enumerator that iterates through a collection.
member.returns: An System.Collections.IEnumerator object that can be used to iterate through the collection.

member.name: M:Ikadn.ValueQueue.CountOf(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the number of elements on given type contained in the Ikadn.ValueQueue.
member.param: Type name of IKADN values to count.

member.name: M:Ikadn.ValueQueue.Dequeue
member.summary: Removes and returns the object at the beginning of the Ikadn.ValueQueue.
member.returns: The object that is removed from the beginning of the Ikadn.ValueQueue.

member.name: M:Ikadn.ValueQueue.Dequeue(System.String)
member.summary: Removes and returns the first element of the Ikadn.ValueQueue with specified type name.
member.param: Type name of IKADN value to dequeue.

member.name: M:Ikadn.ValueQueue.Enqueue(Ikadn.IkadnBaseValue)
member.summary: Adds an object to the end of the Ikadn.ValueQueue.
member.param: The object to add to the Ikadn.ValueQueue. The value can be null for reference types.

member.name: P:Ikadn.ValueQueue.Count
member.summary: Gets the number of elements contained in the Ikadn.ValueQueue.

member.name: P:Ikadn.ValueQueue.IsEmpty
member.summary: Tests whether there are any elements in Ikadn.ValueQueue.

member.summary: Skipping whitespaces encountered end of stream/input.
